page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: We have an active cricket club, but the football team ceased to exist this year. The W.I. meets monthly, as does the Over_60's club. A weekly youth club has recently been suspended as the numbers have dropped too low, but it is hope to start it up again shortly. There is a Whist Drive in the Church Hall once a fortnight. Other activities are organised through the Church, and usually have a fund_ raising purpose. All activities take place in the Church Hall which is our only meeting place. The little school left behind it a tiny swimming pool in the School House garden, and the village children still use it with pleasure. For other socialising the two pubs _ one just outside our reference area _ provide the main focal points for socialising. One pub offers good food in a little restauran
